alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Sedgwick; Sumner; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:47AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Elk, northern Cowley, southeastern Sedgwick, Butler, northeastern Sumner, western Woodson and Greenwood Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 447 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles east of Burns to 5 miles south of Haysville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, El Dorado, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Mulvane, Rose Hill, Eureka, Douglass, Belle Plaine, Towanda, Udall, Leon, Burden, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Grenola and Atlanta. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 29 and 41, and between Mile Markers 51 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Sedgwick; Sumner; Woodson
